item.title: Getting Started
item.description: OpenAerialMap Uploader The OAM imagery database is made of the contributions of users, but to ensure the quality and accuracy of the contents the uploaders need to be approved. Users have to request a token which then can be used in the upload form to validate their identity. Learn more about how to upload. The OAM uploader consists of three different tools: the upload form the token manager app and the server to glue everything together

item.title: Api Server
Token Manager
item.description: The token is a hexadecimal access code that allows the upload of imagery to the OAM database. Administrators can create and manage tokens using the admin interface. Since tokens are not tied to a specific user, a description allows the admin to keep track of the purpose of each one. Tokens can have an expiracy date, a feature that is useful if the token is being generated, for example, for a mapping event.

item.title: Uploader Form
item.description: The upload form is the way for users to contribute to the OAM imagery database. Token Users need a valid token to submit imagery. This helps the OAM team ensure the quality of the submitted materials. The token can be requested either by email or through a github issue. When done via the “Request token” button on the upload form the email/issue will have a template prompting the user for all the needed information.
